body_html:
Beware that the cmake build is not fully supported
and not routinely tested on MacOS.
The cmake build is there mostly for Windows.

However, at least for that particular error
'nsync_time_init.h' file not found
the current master branch of TensorFlow should
get past that point in the build.
The key difference from 1.4 that should fix the issue is in the file
tensorflow/contrib/cmake/patches/nsync/CMakeLists.txt
and especially (new) line 64 of that file.

The cmake build is there mostly for Windows.
However, at least for that particular error
'nsync_time_init.h' file not found

and especially (new) line 64 of that file.
body:
Beware that the cmake build is not fully supported 
and not routinely tested on MacOS.  
The cmake build is there mostly for Windows.

However, at least for that particular error
     'nsync_time_init.h' file not found
the current master branch of TensorFlow should 
get past that point in the build.
The key difference from 1.4 that should fix the issue is in the file
   tensorflow/contrib/cmake/patches/nsync/CMakeLists.txt
and especially (new) line 64 of that file.
